recipe_name: Fennel dip with new potato crisps
author: Tony Tobin
method: For the dip, place all of the dip ingredients into a bowl, mix well and season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. For the crisps, place the vegetable oil into a deep, heavy-bottomed saucepan and heat until a small cube of bread sizzles and turns golden when dropped into it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Carefully place the sliced potatoes into the hot oil and cook until golden-brown and crisp. Remove the potatoes from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper, then sprinkle with salt. To serve, place the crisps onto a plate with the dip in a small bowl alongside.
ingredients: ¼ fennel bulb, finely chopped,  100g/3½oz Greek yoghurt,  ¼ lemon, juice only,  1 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  500ml/18fl oz vegetable oil,  50g/2oz new potatoes, finely sliced,  sea salt, for sprinkling
